page.title: 12Hassocks Railway Station
page.content: Many{commuters}use the railway station. At 5.25 am the first train leaves{Hassocks}for{Gatwick Airport.} Before the last train at 00.26 to{ {Brighton}over 104 trains run from the station. At the station there are two telephone boxes, one postbox, a hotel and a bus stop. The line runs from north to south. There is a car park on the west side costing 50 pence. There are two ticket offices and four waiting rooms (three outside). There are bicycle sheds on both sides. Six people work at the station, two ticket officers (clerical grades) and four uniformed grades on the platform. Between 5.25 and 00.26 approximately 3,500 people travel from Hassocks each weekday; 1,700 each Saturday and 1,100 each Sunday. 472 railway travellers from Hassocks hold season tickets.
